intro: Mancoa secunda, commonly known as the pink mancoa, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate to subtropical climates. Its leaves are ovate and often have a slightly hairy texture, while its stems are woody and branched. Mancoa secunda is valued not only for its ornamental beauty but also for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
